content:
• Monday, December 3, 2012
  • RENN

    Renren (NYSE:RENN) +2.2% AH after receiving an upgrade to Hold from Deutsche, which cites...

    Renren (NYSE:RENN) +2.2% AH after receiving an upgrade to Hold from Deutsche, which cites valuation. The firm is encouraged by Renren's gaming revenue growth and user adds, and sees its operating loss declining to $44M in 2013 from $91M in 2012 as its investment pace slows down. Renren fell 6.4% in regular trading, making new post-IPO lows along the way.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:17 PM | 2 Comments
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX -7%) ended up giving back a meaningful chunk of its recent Icahn-fueled gains...

    Netflix (NFLX -7%) ended up giving back a meaningful chunk of its recent Icahn-fueled gains today. One possible culprit is an Albert Fried note warning Netflix faces a "murder of ravens" (i.e. a bunch of small events that collectively have a big impact) in the form of new competition from Coinstar, TiVo, America Movil, Time Warner and Dish Network. Also, The Telegraph reported over the weekend Netflix, which has $5B in "known" content liabilities, plans to expand its original content investments.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • CWST

    Casella Waste Systems (NASDAQ:CWST): FQ2 EPS of -$0.18 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $120.3M...

    Casella Waste Systems (NASDAQ:CWST): FQ2 EPS of -$0.18 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $120.3M (-7.3% Y/Y) misses by $5M. Shares -4.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:50 PM
  • ESIO

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ESIO +11.7%. PETS +5.6%. DWA +5.2%. OTCPK:IMUC +3.2%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ESIO +11.7%. PETS +5.6%. DWA +5.2%. OTCPK:IMUC +3.2%. PACR +3%.
    After-hours top losers: PBY-OLD -6.4%. PFPT -5.9%. DST -3.9%. PDLI -3.2%. GRMN -2.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM
  • PETS

    PetMed Express (NASDAQ:PETS) declares special dividend of $1.00/share. For shareholders of...

    PetMed Express (NASDAQ:PETS) declares special dividend of $1.00/share. For shareholders of record Dec. 14. Payable Dec. 28. Ex-div date Dec. 12. Shares +5.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM
  • ESIO

    Electro Scientific Industries (NASDAQ:ESIO) declares special dividend of $2.00/share. For...

    Electro Scientific Industries (NASDAQ:ESIO) declares special dividend of $2.00/share. For shareholders of record Dec. 13. Payable Dec. 27. Ex-div date Dec. 11. Shares +11.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM
  • PBY-OLD

    Pep Boys (NYSE:PBY-OLD): Q3 EPS of -$0.13 misses by $0.28. Revenue of $509.6M (-2.4% Y/Y) misses...

    Pep Boys (NYSE:PBY-OLD): Q3 EPS of -$0.13 misses by $0.28. Revenue of $509.6M (-2.4% Y/Y) misses by $18M. Shares -4.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • VRSN

    VeriSign (VRSN +5.1%) recouped some of the giant losses it saw on Friday after Barron's came to...

    VeriSign (VRSN +5.1%) recouped some of the giant losses it saw on Friday after Barron's came to its defense, arguing VeriSign's amended .com domain name registration deal still leaves the company with a high-margin business featuring plenty of visibility. It also noted Wells Fargo's continued bullishness, and conference call remarks about the deal freeing VeriSign to focus on finding ways to monetize its patents.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM
  • GERN

    Geron (NASDAQ:GERN) has resumed trading after announcing it's discontinuing development of its...

    Geron (NASDAQ:GERN) has resumed trading after announcing it's discontinuing development of its GRN1005 brain cancer drug. Shares -12.2% AH to $1.30.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • APL

    Atlas Pipeline Partners (NYSE:APL) agrees to acquire privately-held Cardinal Midstream for...

    Atlas Pipeline Partners (NYSE:APL) agrees to acquire privately-held Cardinal Midstream for $600M; APL boosts 2013 EBITDA guidance to $310M-$360 from $250M-$300M. APL expects the deal to be immediately accretive to distributable cash flow per unit by 3%-5% in 2013 and 8%-10% in 2014. To finance the deal, APL will launch a public offering of 9.25M common units. Shares -2.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM | 2 Comments
  • IMUC

    ImmunoCellular (OTCPK:IMUC) +7% AH after announcing Andrew Gengos, until recently the CEO of...

    ImmunoCellular (OTCPK:IMUC) +7% AH after announcing Andrew Gengos, until recently the CEO of private Neuraltus Pharmaceuticals, is its new CEO. Chief scientific officer John Yu had been serving as interim CEO since August, when former chief Manish Singh stepped down.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • AKS

    AK Steel (AKS -3%) says it prevailed on a key claim in a patent infringement lawsuit...

    AK Steel (AKS -3%) says it prevailed on a key claim in a patent infringement lawsuit brought against the company by ArcelorMittal (NYSE:MT). AKS claims the court decision will allow it to continue to offer its product for sale in the U.S. regardless of the outcome of the new trial on the validity of the patent. A favorite of short sellers, AKS shares tumble anyway.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • CF

    Piper Jaffray weighs in on phosphate makers CF Industries (CF -2%) and Agrium (AGU -2.2%)...

    Piper Jaffray weighs in on phosphate makers CF Industries (CF -2%) and Agrium (AGU -2.2%) with opposite recommendations, but shares of each are lower. The firm thinks the prospect of operational improvements within AGU's crop input distribution business has the potential to drive sustainable earnings growth, but believes earnings upside at CF already is priced in.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • PXD

    Pioneer Southwest Energy Partners (PSE +5.1%) is named a top dividend stock, with insider buying...

    Pioneer Southwest Energy Partners (PSE +5.1%) is named a top dividend stock, with insider buying and a 9.16% yield, according to Dividend Channel, which says PSE shares display attractive valuation metrics, strong profitability metrics, a strong quarterly dividend history and favorable long-term multi-year growth rates in key data points.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 2 Comments
  • MYGN

    Myriad Genetics (MYGN -2.9%) shares slide after the U.S. Supreme Court agreed to hear a...

    Myriad Genetics (MYGN -2.9%) shares slide after the U.S. Supreme Court agreed to hear a challenge to the practice of issuing patents on human genes. Goldman Sachs cuts shares to Neutral from Buy on concerns that a final decision likely won't be reached before midyear. But Jefferies maintains its Buy rating, believing MYGN's patents should ultimately be upheld.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • DWDP

    Still planning for a slow-growth economy, Dow Chemical (DOW -2.7%) says it will shed businesses...

    Still planning for a slow-growth economy, Dow Chemical (DOW -2.7%) says it will shed businesses with ~$1B of annual revenue as part of efforts to retain its long-term financial targets, including its pledge to boost operating earnings to $10B in the "near term." On the plus side, China's manufacturing supply chain started to fire up again in recent weeks, CEO Andrew Liveris says.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA -7.5%) is adding to the Friday losses it saw on news its deal with Facebook (FB...

    Zynga (ZNGA -7.5%) is adding to the Friday losses it saw on news its deal with Facebook (FB -1.6%) had been altered. Zynga's latest executive departures could be a factor, and so might an AllThingsD report about a dinner hosted by Mark Zuckerberg for Facebook game developers. During the dinner, at which Zynga wasn't present, an idea was floated to have Facebook's cut of virtual goods sales change from a current flat fee of 30% to a "sliding scale" in which smaller developers would pay less. However, sources claim there are no immediate plans to do this.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • CBAK-OLD

    China BAK Battery (CBAK-OLD -12.7%) heads lower. SA contributor Richard Pearson, a China...

    China BAK Battery (CBAK-OLD -12.7%) heads lower. SA contributor Richard Pearson, a China resident, claims the end is near for CBAK as its credit lines run dry and it runs out of assets to sell off.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • CUR

    Neuralstem (CUR +7.2%) spikes, possibly related to a Crain's article reporting "amazing results"...

    Neuralstem (CUR +7.2%) spikes, possibly related to a Crain's article reporting "amazing results" in a patient who received 500K stem cells derived by CUR.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • LPIH

    Longwei Petroleum (LPH +14.2%) hits a 52-week high after announcing the expiration of more than...

    Longwei Petroleum (LPH +14.2%) hits a 52-week high after announcing the expiration of more than 10.6M warrants associated with its Oct. 29 private placement financing. LPH now has no warrants or stock options outstanding in its capital structure. LPH also projects FY 2013 revenue growth of ~26% Y/Y to $646M and net income growth of ~24% Y/Y to $77M.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • SQNS

    Midday top 10 gainers: SQNS +32%. CLNT +26%. THTI +24%. RCON +16%. SGOC +15%. CYCC +14%. LTBR...

    Midday top 10 gainers: SQNS +32%. CLNT +26%. THTI +24%. RCON +16%. SGOC +15%. CYCC +14%. LTBR +13%. AXR +13%. OTC:ZAZA +13%. LPH +12%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: TSRI -32%. AOL -14%. SEM -12%. GMED -10%. BCRX -10%. IMRS -9%. SARA -9%. OTC:DCTH -9%. DAIO -9%. RATE -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • SD

    SandRidge Energy (SD +4.3%) powers higher in the wake of TPG-Axon's Friday request for allowing...

    SandRidge Energy (SD +4.3%) powers higher in the wake of TPG-Axon's Friday request for allowing shareholders to vote on replacing the company’s directors, clearing the way for the company to be sold. In response, SD sets Dec. 13 as the record date for determination of stockholders who are entitled to execute, withhold or revoke such consents.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM | 9 Comments
  • AMD

    AMD (AMD +10.7%) is ripping higher again today; shares are now up 30% since the hard-luck...

    AMD (AMD +10.7%) is ripping higher again today; shares are now up 30% since the hard-luck chipmaker announced it would sell and lease back its Austin campus for $150M-$200M. 27.9% of the float was shorted as of Nov. 15 - are diminishing insolvency fears fueling a short-covering rally?
     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM | 4 Comments
  • C

    Citigroup (NYSE:C) quickly erases a loss of nearly 1% as word of positive comments from CLSA's...

    Citigroup (NYSE:C) quickly erases a loss of nearly 1% as word of positive comments from CLSA's Mike Mayo filters out. Talking about a breakup of the bank, Mayo calculates $52 as a sum-of-the-parts valuation.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • WPRT

    Westport Innovations (WPRT +5.5%) moves higher after expanding its product line to include...

    Westport Innovations (WPRT +5.5%) moves higher after expanding its product line to include natural gas-powered versions of Ford's (NYSE:F) F-450 and F-550 Super Duty trucks in mid-2013. WPRT also is developing relationships with service body companies to offer installation of second unit bodies on its F-250 and F-350 pickup trucks.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM | 2 Comments
  • QIHU

    Qihoo (QIHU +11.3%) has surged to new 52-week highs today. No major news has hit the wires, but...

    Qihoo (QIHU +11.3%) has surged to new 52-week highs today. No major news has hit the wires, but investor sentiment towards the company has been improving thanks to the early success of its search engine and (more recently) a solid Q3 report. Last week, Qihoo introduced music and map search services, and the WSJ did a profile piece on controversial founder/CEO Zhou Hongyi.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • SQNS

    4G baseband chipmaker Sequans (SQNS +29.1%) has soared after announcing its chips will power "a...

    4G baseband chipmaker Sequans (SQNS +29.1%) has soared after announcing its chips will power "a significant portion" of the devices used in the next stage of China Mobile's (NYSE:CHL) TD-LTE 4G trials. CHL plans to deploy 20K base stations for its trial through Q2 (benefiting Alcatel-Lucent), as it awaits regulatory approval for a full commercial launch. Sequans, which has struggled to secure 4G design wins while competing against Qualcomm and others, had a short ratio of 17 as of Nov. 15.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • SXC

    SunCoke Energy (SXC -7.8%) defers plans for an IPO of its SunCoke Energy Partners subsidiary,...

    SunCoke Energy (SXC -7.8%) defers plans for an IPO of its SunCoke Energy Partners subsidiary, the latest in a series of companies to defer or cancel IPOs. SXC says it plans to initiate the offering as soon as market conditions improve.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • QLGC

    Storage adapter card/switch vendors QLogic (QLGC -8.1%) and Emulex (ELX -4.8%) are down hard...

    Storage adapter card/switch vendors QLogic (QLGC -8.1%) and Emulex (ELX -4.8%) are down hard after receiving downgrades to Sell (I, II) from Goldman: the firm thinks QLogic's FY13 targets are at risk due to macro issues, and is worried about the impact of investment needs, macro, and litigation risk on Emulex's near-term performance. Shares of both companies have fared poorly in recent months. Mellanox (MLNX -3.2%), which competes with QLogic and Emulex in the Ethernet adapter card market, is also lower.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • LDK

    LDK Solar (LDK -9.8%) has tumbled post-earnings. While Q3 results beat estimates, LDK guided for...

    LDK Solar (LDK -9.8%) has tumbled post-earnings. While Q3 results beat estimates, LDK guided for Q4 revenue of $230M-$290M, pretty far below a consensus of $552.4M. Though few likely expected guidance to hit consensus given LDK's history, the magnitude of the shortfall is still eye-popping. Q3 gross margin was a less-than-inspiring -11.2%, though this is actually better than Q2's -39.1%. (PR) (also falling post-earnings: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • CLR

    Continental Resources (CLR +4.8%) successfully completes the Charlotte 3-22H, its first...

    Continental Resources (CLR +4.8%) successfully completes the Charlotte 3-22H, its first horizontal well to test the third bench of the Three Forks zone in the Bakken field. Stifel Nicolaus upgrades CLR to Buy from Hold, seeing an attractive entry point, top-tier underlying asset quality in the Bakken, and asset upside via upcoming bench tests in Three Forks providing near-term catalysts.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • EQU

    Equal Energy (EQU -2.4%) lashes out at "reckless demands" by dissident shareholders and bloggers...

    Equal Energy (EQU -2.4%) lashes out at "reckless demands" by dissident shareholders and bloggers "that risk jeopardizing the company's long-term stability." Last week, EQU completed a strategic review it says sought a "balance between future growth and return of capital to shareholders."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • FNSR

    Finisar (FNSR +3.2%) opens with a solid gain after Needham upgrades shares to Buy and sets an...

    Finisar (FNSR +3.2%) opens with a solid gain after Needham upgrades shares to Buy and sets an $18 PT. The firm cites improved 2013 service provider capex following a rough 2012; improving demand for Finisar's ROADM line cards and LcOS optical switches, and continued sell-outs for its high-end 40G/100G optical transceivers. Rivals are also doing well today: OCLR +1.6%. JDSU +2.2%. OPLK +2.8%. So is equipment vendor Ciena (CIEN +2.7%), which has strong 40G/100G exposure.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM
  • HMA

    Health Management Associates (NYSE:HMA) rebuts as "inaccurate" a 60 Minutes report on...

    Health Management Associates (NYSE:HMA) rebuts as "inaccurate" a 60 Minutes report on allegations doctors faced pressure to admit patients from the emergency room to fill hospital beds. CRT Capital cuts HMA to Sell, seeing significantly more risk of a bigger federal investigation and potential settlement fines - “as serious an allegation of fraud as we have ever heard." HMA -4.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM | 1 Comment
  • SVU

    Shares of Supervalu (NYSE:SVU) are up 13% premarket as Cerberus continues to drive closer to a...

    Shares of Supervalu (NYSE:SVU) are up 13% premarket as Cerberus continues to drive closer to a purchase (full or partial) of the grocery store chain's assets. With shares swapping hands at $2.68, the dreamy bulls who were calling out a run to $3 for SVU are starting to look good.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • TPCG

    Chemical maker TPC Group (NASDAQ:TPCG) -6.4% premarket after Innospec (NASDAQ:IOSP) says it...

    Chemical maker TPC Group (NASDAQ:TPCG) -6.4% premarket after Innospec (NASDAQ:IOSP) says it is withdrawing its takeover proposal. A bidding war looked to have been brewing, as IOSP's $47.50/share offer last month trumped an earlier $45 bid from P-E firms First Reserve and SK Capital Partners.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM
  • WWAV

    WhiteWave Foods (NYSE:WWAV) announces it sold a number of assets to Morningstar Foods (NYSE:DF)...

    WhiteWave Foods (NYSE:WWAV) announces it sold a number of assets to Morningstar Foods (NYSE:DF) for $60M. The sale is in connection with a larger transaction in which Dean Foods will unload its Morningstar business to Japan-based Saputo for a cool $1.45B. WWAV +1.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • SVU

    Premarket gainers: SVU +13%. DECK +10%. PPHM +7%. DELL-OLD +6%. GFA-OLD +6%. DF +5%. Losers: MMR...

    Premarket gainers: SVU +13%. DECK +10%. PPHM +7%. DELL-OLD +6%. GFA-OLD +6%. DF +5%.
    Losers: MMR -10%. TPCG -6%. LDK -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • MMR

    McMoRan Exploration (NYSE:MMR) -9.2% premarket following another negative update from its Davy...

    McMoRan Exploration (NYSE:MMR) -9.2% premarket following another negative update from its Davy Jones No. 1 well, as recent operations to stimulate the well by injecting a solvent to dissolve barite in the perforations had limited success. This follows last week's Davy Jones update, which sent shares reeling 31%. Energy XXI (EXXI), which owns a working interest in the well, -1.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM
  • BB

    Research in Motion (RIMM) is downgraded to Sell at Canaccord, which says the fundamentals don't...

    Research in Motion (RIMM) is downgraded to Sell at Canaccord, which says the fundamentals don't support the recent 30% gain in the stock price. The BB10 is an improvement, says Canaccord's Mike Walkley, but he assigns "a very low probability" it can turn around the company's long-term business trends. Shares -1.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM | 7 Comments
  • SCMP

    Sucampo Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SCMP) -8.4% premarket after announcing Friday the FDA extended...

    Sucampo Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SCMP) -8.4% premarket after announcing Friday the FDA extended by three months its review of the company's Amitiza drug to treat opioid-induced constipation in patients with chronic, non-cancer pain. The FDA decides to extend the goal date to provide time for a full review of supportive analyses it had requested.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM | 1 Comment
  • TOT

    Total (NYSE:TOT) +1.4% premarket after Deutsche Bank upgrades shares to Buy, based on an...

    Total (NYSE:TOT) +1.4% premarket after Deutsche Bank upgrades shares to Buy, based on an attractive valuation "ahead of the broadest and potentially most exciting 2013 exploration program among the European majors." The firm also cites a secure 6%-plus dividend yield "offering absolute support." Royal Dutch Shell (RDS.A, RDS.B) is cut to Hold.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM
  • DF

    Dean Foods (NYSE:DF) announces it sold its Morningstar Foods division to Saputo for $1.45B....

    Dean Foods (NYSE:DF) announces it sold its Morningstar Foods division to Saputo for $1.45B. After netting out taxes and expenses, the company expects to realize $887M in proceeds which will all go toward retiring outstanding debt. DF +6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM
  • BBY

    Shares of Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) move up 1.2% premarket with the progression of Richard Schulze's...

    Shares of Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) move up 1.2% premarket with the progression of Richard Schulze's bid to take the firm private still a major focus of investors. Also in the mix is the profitable quarter (I, II) just turned in by Conn's on the back of its double-digit same store sales growth. Did Conn's push the right button by focusing on furniture over lower margin consumer electronics items? Just ask RadioShack (NYSE:RSH), down 79% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM | 4 Comments
  • DELL-OLD

    DELL-OLD pops 5.5% premarket after Goldman's weekend 2-notch upgrade of the stock to Buy from...

    DELL-OLD pops 5.5% premarket after Goldman's weekend 2-notch upgrade of the stock to Buy from Sell, along with a hike in the price target to $13 from $9. Bad news on the PC front is baked in, says Goldman, and the strong balance sheet should provide downside support and maybe set the stage for an LBO or recapitalization.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 AM
  • CONN

    Conn's (NASDAQ:CONN): Q3 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $206.4M (+10.6% Y/Y) beats by...

    Conn's (NASDAQ:CONN): Q3 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $206.4M (+10.6% Y/Y) beats by $7M. Shares +1.7% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:03 AM
  • DECK

    Shares of Deckers Outdoor (NASDAQ:DECK) race 8% higher after an upgrade from Sterne Agee...

    Shares of Deckers Outdoor (NASDAQ:DECK) race 8% higher after an upgrade from Sterne Agee resonates. The heavily-shorted stock has fallen out of favor on the Street, but Sterne's lush new price target of $65 paints the retailer in a different light.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:03 AM

  • Greek 10-year bond yields plummet 1.46 percentage points to 14.66% following the government's...

    Greek 10-year bond yields plummet 1.46 percentage points to 14.66% following the government's release of details about its debt buyback program, while the ASE share index rises 1.3% in Athens. Spanish bond yields are also falling, down 9 bps to 5.22%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 AM | 4 Comments

  • Asian stocks are mixed, with Japan rising again but China continuing its dog run despite the...

    Asian stocks are mixed, with Japan rising again but China continuing its dog run despite the country's decent PMI data, which has nevertheless helped send EU shares higher. Japan +0.1%, Hong Kong -1.2%, China -1%, India -0.4%. EU Stoxx 50 +0.5%, London +0.3%, Paris +0.6%, Frankfurt +0.4%, Milan +1%, Madrid +0.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 AM
